storyInfo: Jordi helps Ulpianus send a warning to the Abyssal Hunters from the tower. Their beacon planted, the Hunters are ready to return when they are swarmed. Meanwhile, above the tower, the Seaborn begin to seep into the city through the dome.

attributes.content: Señor... Ulpianus?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: You?
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: Phew... So it is you, okay.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: We met once, at Gran Faro, actually it was you who approached me... Though I never learned your name until after I got here.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Please, you're not supposed to be here, it's—
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Control center for the beacon tower.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: That man on the floor... did you do that?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: It's the most fitting end for one who fell.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: What did he do?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: None of your business, young one. Leave this place, for your own safety.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: The nest beacons have all been activated. The sabotaged weapons are warming up. How else can I warn the Hunters...?
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: Is Laurentina's group in danger?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Did this man do it? Is that why you...?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: You won't tell me. You don't trust me... Well, I don't trust you either, honestly. You never introduce yourself, and seeing all this, it's really only right to suspect you.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: But they're your friends. You're a Hunter, too. I think I know a little about your tales together.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: He did his dirty work on them before they left.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: They're still caught in the Seaborn tide for now. I'm not entirely certain what's going to happen, but the danger is definite.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: If they went to plant the beacon and are still in the nest, maybe we could send their beacon a signal from this tower, to warn them.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: I was helping out here earlier. I know roughly how the basic controls work.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: ...Then do it.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: O-Okay.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Well?
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: It's much more complex in practice, but I can say this tower seems to operate on a very similar framework to a lighthouse's control system.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: As far as I'm aware, Breogan passed through this city and aided the tower reconstruction effort.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: The technician mentioned that the tower will automatically navigate the weapons once every beacon is active, and all other controls will be locked out by the program.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: So if we want to send a signal to one of these beacons—let me see...
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Just as I feared, it's impossible to resume control.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Do you have any way to circumvent the lockdown?
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: If Breogan was involved in the reconstruction, then maybe, just maybe... I have a very stupid plan.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: My entire time here in Milliarium, I've been trying to get to understand the man Breogan was.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: He had a habit of writing things down. Always noting his thoughts, his suspicions, etc. He kept it up even on dry land.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Was it so he wouldn't forget things? I think... I can try temporarily shutting down the main control panel's data decomposition system, like this—
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Um, before, you were bringing up... my history...
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: You called me Breogan's descendant, but just from looking at his images, you can tell I don't resemble the genius architect one bit.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: My parents were just Ægirs 'rooted' to the land. There are plenty of us across Iberia and the other terrestrial countries. Strictly speaking, we don't even count as...
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: So what?
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: It... it used to trouble me, but recently I've been learning to let myself get over it, to not think so hard about it.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: It's just, you were the first to ever mention that to me, so I wanted to be sure. Um, why did you think I was...
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: True, I did miss the mark, but I never engage in baseless speculation.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: There is more of a bond between you than you think.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: A bond?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: The Profound Silence ruined Iberia. The lighthouses fell dark along the coast, and doubt and suspicion grew in their shadow.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: Breogan was forced to flee the splendor he himself had designed. Gran Faro was one place he sheltered while on the run. The research notes your parents left you are undoubtedly connected to him.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: They were people he knew he could entrust his life's work to.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: Look at what you're doing now, young one. You may not be his descendant by blood, but you have most certainly inherited a portion of his wisdom.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: Milliarium is the first Ægirian city you visited and, coincidentally, the last Breogan stopped at before leaving the country entirely.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: His trail covers the entire seabed, and everywhere he went he visited those of great repute to share his thoughts on dry land, his conjectures on Terra's future.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: He had hoped someone would head for the continent with him, so that one day land and sea might stand against crisis together, seek new possibilities together.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: Many admired him for his talent, but perhaps his suggestions were too ahead of his time, for in the end hardly any responded to his invitation.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: In Milliarium, he even volunteered to take part in this tower's reconstruction, in exchange for an audience with the then consul.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: And?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Do you need to ask? He was rejected.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: But as the work finished, he made the final decision to wrap up his winding tour and officially depart for the faraway soils.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: Even if his time on the road had gained him practically no support.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: Think over what you've done. You left the town you knew, and came to this alien place they call your home. That, too, took incredible courage.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: In this respect, you and Breogan are not dissimilar. Conversely, if all you'd shared was just blood, then that would have been something to be ashamed of.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: I do not usually play psychological counselor, Jordi Fontanarossa.
attributes.name: Ulpianus
Jordi
attributes.content: I think, really, I...

attributes.name: Jordi
attributes.content: Ah.
That did it. At the very least, signaling a single beacon shouldn't be an issue—let's see, Nest 37...
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: I hope Laurentina and her friends notice.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Actually, Señor Ulpianus.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Is it just me, or is the air getting... stuffy?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: My comms just picked up a faint gravitational wave. What a strange feeling, seeing the ripples in spacetime with my own eyes.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Just like in the manual. Seems the beacon's already active.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: According to Clementia, this beacon going live should mean the Class IV weapon array will automatically come online.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: We should head back the way we came, immediately.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Aw, and here I was thinking we'd stay behind and enjoy our front-row seats!
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: What's so fun about watching cannons fire?
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Oh? Weren't we supposed to have something rather different in store?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: I thought we'd see the Seaborn silently 'popping' all at once across the entire stretch. How poetic, how fitting, when you consider all the little bastards' wrongs, no?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Though Class IV weaponry may not affect us, pointless dithering will only invite more variables.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Hrmph, fine. Off we go, then.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: (Vacuole merrily whirls)
A soft murmur reaches Specter's ear, and when she turns to look, she meets with an eye. More accurately, a 'nucleus' leaping to and fro.
The flagella of the Seaborn sticks to her cheek, soft as a kiss. Specter sees the nucleus pulsing in a clear rhythm, blending with her own heartbeat.
Shark!
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Don't attack yet, Skadi.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: It went straight past us?
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Doesn't strike me that we spooked it. More like something pulled it away.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: The beacon!
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Captain?
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: The gravitational waves coming from this thing aren't supposed to be so irregular, are they?
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Skadi, behind you!
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Move!
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: (Vacuole merrily whirls)
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: (Soft membrane cheerily stirs)
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: (Creased skin excitedly shudders)
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: The currents reverse.
The tide sweeping the Seaborn surges back into the nest. The sound of beating membranous wings, of compressing and unfolding, of clamoring mouthparts, of roaring streams...
The whole space reverberates with layer upon layer of cries—of pure elation!
The beacon's been completely drowned out.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: The eggs and newborns are multiplying rapidly!
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Clementia said all formless newborns would enter straight into necrosis, and the mature individuals would flee from the area.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: While the fungal mat, the vegetation... the whole nest would decay, starting from the environment.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: But clearly we're not seeing much of a 'collective necrosis' here, are we?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: If anything, I'd say they're full of life!
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Pull back!
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Gladiia turns the instant she barks the order, her lance piercing the Seaborn ahead as ruptured tissues bursts about like blood.
Ever since that little bastard touched my face, I've been feeling sleepy, somehow...
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: How very strange. It's been so long since I felt this way...
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Ugh, I thought it was just me.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: This shouldn't be...
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Combat only sharpens an Abyssal Hunter's lucidity.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Blandus?
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: You mean the auto-adaptive junction surgery?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: We discovered an anomaly, and Blandus certainly treated us, but he also tampered with the procedure.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Yet whether coincidence or not, the Church's attack cleared our suspicions of him.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: ...This was my mistake.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: But, he's the Advisor. Why would he?
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: If we want answers, we must make it back to the city.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Specter skips ahead at the vanguard, her dance as graceful as ever. With but a twirl, a high-RPM sawblade leaves the Seaborn ahead carved in two.
(Vacuole excitedly swells)
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: The beasts have noticed us, and yet show hardly any will to attack.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Captain, Shark, have you noticed the water flowing... slower?
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Get a hold of yourself, Skadi.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: No, wait. She's right.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: These animals are secreting something.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Finally, the tide receding, the nest temporarily bares the truth of its transformation.
Seaborn living and dead fall into every ravine in the seabed. The nest's borders have begun to bleach, chitin coming together into a thick crust.
Something has provided them immense nutrition. The whole nest is forming a carapace, and spurring every life within to evolve faster.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: A 'shell.' If we take the Iberian's so-called 'nethersea brand' as the roadmap for the organisms' expansion, then this shell is the final act of fuelling before it begins.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Without warning, the beacon pulsed irregular gravitational waves. Right afterward, the Seaborn swarm began to nest around it...
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Either this is some elusive aberration in the weapons themselves, or someone in the city is trying to remotely control the beacon to transmit information. Or possibly both.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Whatever Blandus did to us during surgery has dulled our senses.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Consider the hunt on! Time is of the essence! Get out of here!
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: *pant*, *cough*—
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Your cheeks are flushed, and your clothes soaked through with sweat.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: I-I'm not nervous!
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: No.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: You're accustomed to dry, arid land. You're more sensitive to dampness than an average Ægir.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: The humidity is wracking you.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: Hold on...
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Look, look at the chart!
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Densely packed bio-signatures... from—from right above us?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: It's the dome above the tower... The Seaborn are seeping into the city through there.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: No, but weren't there two Legions out there keeping them at bay? Plus the Hunters...
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Even, even if some from other nests slipped around the perimeter, Milliarium still has countless sensor units across the dome, and all sorts of complex defenses...
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: How could the Seaborn get into the city without a sound?
attributes.name: Jordi
Jordi
attributes.content: Did this tower draw them in?

attributes.name: Jordi
attributes.content: *cough* *cough*, *pant*—But why?
attributes.joined: Did this tower draw them in?*cough* *cough*, *pant*—But why?

attributes.content: My guess is, someone showed them the path.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: Blandus, had it ever dawned on you that your folly would lead to such disaster?
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: Ulpianus is pensive.

He does not turn to look at the culprit of all this, lying motionless on the floor. He stares closely at the holographic sea chart. Dots representing the Seaborn swarm converge right on Milliarium's coordinates.
They shine like the stars.
